Republic.Introduction: Coins of the Indian rupee (INR) were first minted in "1950". New coins have been produced annually since then and they make up a valuable aspect of the Indian currency system. Today, circulating coins exist in denominations of One Rupee, Two Rupees, Five Rupees, Ten Rupees and Twenty Rupees. All of these are produced by four mints located across India, in Kolkata, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Noida.

Lettering: डॉ बी आर अम्बेडकर की 125 वीं जयंती 2015 125TH BIRTH ANNIVERSARY OF DR. B.R. AMBEDKAR
Translation: 125th Birth Anniversary of Dr BR Ambedkar

Coin.Title: 10 Rupees Gandhi: Return from South Africa

Features.Composition: Bimetallic: copper-nickel centre in aluminium-bronze ring

Coin.Obverse:
Ashoka Pillar, Denomination Below with rupee symbol
Lettering: भारत INDIA सत्यमेव जयते ₹10
Coin.Reverse:
Depicts both young Mahatma Gandhi and Gandhi Ji in old age, showing his transformation from a pravasi to Mahatma
Lettering: दक्षिण अफ्रीका से वापसी RETURN FROM SOUTH AFRICA 1915 - 2015 शताब्दी स्मरणोत्सव CENTENARY COMMEMORATION महात्मा गांधी MAHATMA GANDHI

Coin.Title: 10 Rupees International Day of Yoga

Features.Composition: Bimetallic: copper-nickel centre in aluminium-bronze ring

Coin.Obverse:
Ashoka Pillar, Denomination Below with rupee symbol
Lettering: भारत INDIA सत्यमेव जयते ₹10
Coin.Reverse:
Human figure seated in front of a lotus in a Yoga pose. Globe encircled by hands folded in prayer. Legend in English and Devnagari ( outer circle - 'Antarrashtriya Yog Diwas', inner circle - 'Samamjasya Evam Shanti Ke Liye Yog')
Lettering: अनतर्राष्ट्रीय योग दिवस INTERNATIONAL DAY OF YOGA सामंजस्य एवं शान्ति के लिए योग YOGA FOR HARMONY AND PEACE 21 JUNE 2015
Translation: International Day for Yoga Yoga for Harmony and Peace
